Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: Patient expresses feelings of nervousness during the session, indicating discomfort with the new environment.
Trauma History: Patient shares traumatic experiences of being raped and sodomized, detailing the severity of the events and their lasting impact.
History of Present Illness (HPI): Patient reports feeling uneasy and uncomfortable lately, with changes in behavior and thoughts since the traumatic events.
Medical and Psychiatric History: Patient has been diagnosed with PTSD a few years ago and sought help due to feelings of revenge towards the perpetrators.
Psychosocial History: Patient discusses a close relationship with family, particularly mentioning their mother as a positive influence and a source of values.
Physiological Observations: Patient struggles with sleep, often feeling sluggish and irritable when not well-rested.
Current Functional Status: Patient is currently not working in nursing but plans to return to therapy for support.
Progress Evaluation: Patient acknowledges some benefits from past therapy, noting improvements in self-calming techniques.
Next Steps: Patient intends to return to therapy to continue addressing their mental health needs.
